description: The Bass river of five Islands was one of the first brooks I explored for falls a while ago.  The main reason is that there are two falls on the 1:50 000 topo maps.  I visited those and put up a post on trailpeak. Fast forward a decade and now satellite imagery is getting very precise.  I noticed some white spots downstream of the falls I had already been to.  so of course I decided to check those out.  The descent into the ravine is moderate and you can follow a secondary stream which has a 15ft drop.  Once you reach the river, you can either follow it and sometimes get a bit wet or stay on the slope.    The first white spot was just large rapids but the next one at N45° 27' 24.1" W64° 02' 45.7" had a nice 1ft drop.  Further upstream was another white spot but again just rapids.  finally i reached the best part of the whole river ...a large fall located at; N45° 27' 41.9" W64° 02' 46.0".  Its the nicest and tallest of all the falls on this river and for a strange reason its not the ones mapped out on the topo maps!  I ended the hike by going back to one of the marked falls which I had been previously and then bushwacked my way to my car.
directions: Highway 2 in Five Islands.  Take New Britain Rd and turn left on secondary road at; N45° 27' 04.5" W64° 02' 04.4".  Drive 600m or so and park.  Bushwack west to the ravine...
title: Lower Bass River of Five Islands Falls
